Key Arguments: The bill is seen as a direct attack on democracy and freedom of speech.
It grants arbitrary power to the ACMA, likened to a 'Ministry of Truth'.
Concerns about the control of information by elites and politicians.
Cites past COVID-19 management as an example of misinformation control.
Claims that valid concerns during the pandemic were censored or suppressed.
Notable Quotes: This bill will give arbitrary power to the independent regulator, the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA), with new laws to control the spread of information online.
In Orwellian terms, the ACMA will become Australia’s ‘Ministry of Truth’.
One only needs to do a little research into the past few years to demonstrate how dangerous a ‘Ministry of Truth’ would be for our society to function in a free and democratic way.
